Sort observations by the patient to take the patient with the highest number of observations

```{r}

summary(observations.csv)

observations.csv <-with(observations.csv , observations.csv[order(PATIENT),])

patients_most_obs <- unique(observations.csv$PATIENT)[0:64]

observations.csv.subset <- observations.csv[observations.csv$PATIENT %in% patients_most_obs,]

write.csv(observations.csv.subset, file = "observations_subset.csv",row.names=TRUE)


```

```{r}

# create table
y <- exprs(genomic_data[[1]])
Index <- pData(genomic_data[[1]])$title)
d <- rowMeans(y[,Index==2]) - rowMeans(y[, Index==1])
a <- rowMeans(y)
smoothScatter(a, d, main="MA plot", xlab="A", ylab="M")
abline(h=c(-1,1), col="red")


```
